name: demagogy
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
the action or fact of winning support by exciting the emotions of ordinary people rather than by having good or morally right ideas: A climate of fear makes people more susceptible to demagogy. He didn't hesitate to use demagogy to further his aims. See
demagogue
More examplesFewer examplesThe old demagogy of the first Bolshevik revolution was completely absent.It is very easy to sense the difference between demagogy and sincerity.There is nothing easier than to engage in cheap demagogy.
